metadata.title: CVE-2014-3591 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Libgcrypt before 1.6.3 and GnuPG before 1.4.19 does not implementciphertext blinding for Elgamal decryption, which allows physicallyproximate attackers to obtain the server's private key by determiningfactors using crafted ciphertext and the fluctuations in theelectromagnetic field during multiplication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.1-2ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2ubuntu1.14.04.1').
libgcrypt11 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.2').
gnupg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3').
